bibl.title: Form letter from Calvin DeWitt of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, [19--]

div1.p: This form letter from DeWitt solicits contributions to the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Form letter from Calvin DeWitt of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, [19--]
div1.opener:
President,
D. C. GILMAN, LL. D.,
PREST. CARNEGIE INSTITUTE.
Vice-President,
GEN. G. M. STERNBERG, LL. D.,
FORMER SURGEON-GENERAL, U. S. ARMY.
Treasurer,
MR. CHAS. J. BELL,
PREST. AMERICAN SECURITY & TRUST CO.
Secretary
GEN. C. DEWITT, U. S. ARMY.
Walter Reed Memorial Association
Washington, D. C.
Executive Committee.
----
OFFICERS OF THE
ASSOCIATION.
MAJOR J. R. KEAN,
SURGEON, U. S. ARMY.
MAJOR W. D. McCAW,
SURGEON, U. S. ARMY.
A. F. N. KING, M. D.
div1.p:
The Walter Reed Memorial Association has been incorporated
under the General Laws of the District of Columbia to give
unity to the various proposals which have been made for the
securing of a Memorial Fund.

This Association is now organized for the collection and
care of such sums as may be entrusted to it. Printed papers
explanatory of the services of Major Reed, U. S. A., and
respecting this Association are ready for distribution and
will be sent to those who apply for them.

Contributions from individuals, medical societies, boards
of trade and other business organizations are now solicited.
They may be sent to the Treasurer, Charles J. Bell, American
Security and Trust Company, Washington, by whom they will be
acknowledged.
div1.closer:
By order of the Executive Committee. C. DeWitt.
Secretary, No. 1707 21st Street N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
